item.title: VMware vSAN 6.7u1 — What's New?
item.description: VMworld 2018 US is upon us, and as per usual this means a lot of new announcements. One of them is vSAN 6.7u1 which comes with a bunch of new and useful features. This release mainly focuses on improved operations and maintenance, with a bunch of nice new additions. I’ve focused on a couple of them here, but this is not a defintive list! Simplified Upgrade Experience Through VMware Update Manager (VUM) Firmware and drivers for vSAN has now been moved into VMware Update Manager (VUM) for centralized management, this means that the vSAN IO Controller Firmware Tool now integrated into VUM.

item.title: VMware vSAN 6.6 - What's New for Day 2 Operations?
item.description: VMware has just announced vSAN v6.6, with over 20 new features. While new and shiny features are nice I’d like to highlight a couple that I think might be undervalued from release feature-set perspective, but highly valuable in day to day operations of a vSAN environment, otherwise known as Day 2 operations.
